3) MS142 - Clean mineral spirits operation, identified as P-100, constructed in 2007, with a maximum capacity of 6,000 gallons per hour, processing mineral spirits to produce clean solvents, residue, and light fuel, utilizing no control devices, and exhausting to the ambient air, and consisting of:
(a) One (1) natural gas-fired boiler, identified as S8-200, with a maximum capacity of 14.645 MM8tu/hr, and exhausting through stack S8-200.
(b) One (1) Distillation Column and associated ancillary equipment, identified asMS142.
(c) One (1) Vacuum system used to collect and transfer off-gas from MS142 to T-102.
(d) One (1) Caustic Scrubber, identified as T-102, used to remove odor from MS142 off-gasses.

Utilities include production equipment and distribution systems for steam, instrument air and nitrogen for operation of the refinery.

Onsite tankage consists of fifty-one tanks used to support refinery feed, intermediate processing and final product storage and shipping.

The Heritage Crystal-Clean Indianapolis Re-Refinery operations comply with OSHA Standard 29 CFR 1910.119, Process Safety Management of highly hazardous chemicals via Corporate and Local management's commitment to the elements of PSM by applying the programs and policies found in the standard to activities throughout the facility. Specific program elements include:
1. Employee Participation - It is the policy of Heritage Crystal-Clean (HCC) to seek participation of employees at all levels in establishing procedures and practices that govern Health, Safety and Environmental issues.  The PSM Policy includes a description of how the Employee Participation element is implemented in PSM-02; 
2. Process Safety Information - Process safety information is maintained for the facility.  The PSM Policy includes a description of how the Process Safety Information element is implemented in PSM-03; 
3. Process Hazard Analysis - A detailed process hazard assessment, using HAZOP, is conducted
